newsitem.title: USA: U.S. corporate bonds end firmer after FOMC meeting.
newsitem.headline: U.S. corporate bonds end firmer after FOMC meeting.

text.p: U.S. corporate high-grade and junk bonds closed higher in moderate trade after Federal Reserve policymakers elected to leave short-term interest rates unchanged, analysts said.
High-grades corporate traders reported a one to two basis point tightening on the long end of the curve as Treasuries failed to enhance a modest morning rally after the Fed's decision.
The benchmark 30-year long bond ended up 14/32 at 97-01/32 to yield 6.99 percent. The 30-year bond was up 12/32 right before the Fed's announcement.
